title: Compact Inline Form
reference-overview:
The Compact Inline Form is intended to be used when there are a small number of fields used on the form and the form needs to be displayed in a tight area. It is normally used in conjunction with Placeholder Text, and usually without a corresponding Field Label.

**Not all form layouts will work well together
reference-usage: Use the Compact Inline Form when you only have a few fields on the Form. You can also use this form when you only have a small area in which to display the Form, like within a login container or an advanced search or filter functionality associated with a data grid.
reference-details:
Labels

All field labels should be replaced with Placeholder text, which should use Title Case. See the Copy/Text Style Guide narrative for more detail.

Required Fields

Required fields are not denoted on a Compact Inline Form.

Error Handling

Should work as defined on the Field Specific Error Message page for details, with the following exception:

  • There is no Required Icon, so the error version of the Required Icon should never be displayed.
reference-mobile:
The font size will increase slightly.

Any associated buttons will stack on top of one another and stretch 100% of the available width.
